skill.description: Expert at suggesting specific, actionable improvements to Claude's responses and work. Use when Claude's output needs enhancement, when quality issues are identified, or when iterating on solutions.

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. Only contains instructional text for suggesting improvements with read-only file access tools.

content.user_title: Suggest actionable improvements for code and responses
content.value_statement: Claude sometimes produces outputs that need refinement. This skill provides structured frameworks for identifying specific issues and suggesting concrete improvements with clear examples.
actual_capabilities: Identifies specific issues in code, responses, and solutions
Provides structured frameworks for improvement suggestions
Shows before and after code examples for patterns
Prioritizes improvements by impact and urgency
Suggests alternative approaches with trade-off analysis
Creates verification steps to confirm improvements work
limitations: Only suggests improvements - does not implement changes automatically
Requires Claude to invoke the skill; not a standalone tool
Cannot access runtime environments or execute tests
Suggestions are advisory; implementation depends on user action

use_cases.title: Code quality enhancement
use_cases.description: Get specific suggestions for improving code structure, performance, security, and maintainability.

use_cases.title: Documentation improvement
use_cases.description: Receive guidance on making explanations clearer, adding examples, and improving documentation completeness.

use_cases.title: Structured feedback
use_cases.description: Apply consistent frameworks for providing actionable, prioritized improvement suggestions.

prompt_templates.title: Quick code review
prompt_templates.scenario: Get improvement suggestions for recent code
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this code and suggest specific improvements: [paste code or reference file]

prompt_templates.title: Response refinement
prompt_templates.prompt: My previous response about [topic] could be better. Suggest specific improvements to make it clearer and more complete.

prompt_templates.title: Pattern application
prompt_templates.prompt: This code has [specific issue]. Apply the extract function pattern to suggest how to refactor it.

prompt_templates.title: Prioritization
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze these [code files/changes] and prioritize the improvements by impact level with justification.

output_examples.input: Suggest improvements for this Python function that validates user input
output: Issue: No input validation allows potential errors
Improvement: Add type checking and positive integer validation
Before: def process_data(user_id): user = db.get_user(user_id); return user.process()
After: Validate type, check for positive value, handle missing user
Benefits: Prevents errors, improves security, clearer error messages

best_practices: Be specific and concrete - show exactly what to change, not vague descriptions
Always provide before and after examples to demonstrate the improvement
Prioritize suggestions by impact to focus on what matters most
anti_patterns: Making vague suggestions like 'make it better' without specific changes
Suggesting improvements without explaining the rationale behind them
Ignoring trade-offs and presenting only one approach as the solution

faq.question: How does this skill differ from a code review tool?
faq.answer: This skill provides guidance and frameworks for Claude to suggest improvements. It does not automatically analyze or modify code.

faq.question: What tools can Claude use with this skill?
faq.answer: The skill is configured with read-only tools (Read, Grep, Glob) for examining code without making changes.

faq.question: Can this skill implement the improvements it suggests?
faq.answer: No, this skill only suggests improvements. Claude can use additional tools to implement changes if authorized.

faq.question: Does this skill store any user data?
faq.answer: No, this is a prompt-based skill that only provides guidance. It does not store or transmit any data.

faq.question: Why are only read tools allowed?
faq.answer: The skill focuses on analysis and suggestion. Write tools are not needed for its core purpose of identifying improvements.

faq.question: How does this compare to automated refactoring tools?
faq.answer: Automated tools make changes directly. This skill provides structured suggestions Claude can present to users for approval.
